data.title: Nice location
data.text: The food is good and the Margaritas are very good. We are usually here with a group of 8 - 12. The restaurant seats us in a room with a single large table. This is located in downtown Muncie. Parking is on the street or in a public lot nearby.

data.title: Very good Mexican food
data.text: Always enjoy dining at casa del sol, there food is always good. My wife and I especially like dining outside when the weather is nice. There Margaritas are the best in muncie.  The chips and salsa are also very good. My favorite meal is the Polo Toluca with the chorizo.

data.title: Surprised by the price for such good food
data.text: I had a business luncheon at Casa Del Sol the first time I ever ate there. I ordered the enchilada which is my usual Mexican dish. It was very good, had rice and beans with it. I was surprised at the price for such a good lunch portion. I was completely stuffed by the time we left.  The chips and salsa are very tasty too. I will have to go back to try dinner some time.

data.title: Didn't Know What To Expect
data.text: I was prepared to have just an ok meal.  I have heard they are comparable to Ciudad's which I am not a fan of.  This place was way better.  The food and service were great!

data.title: Authentic
data.text: We were passing through from out of town and stopped here on a whim. We were very impressed. Everything we tried was delicious. This is good authentic Mexican food.

data.title: Very good Mexican fare!
data.text: The Ceviche is awesome here. I also enjoyed the casa fajita taco salad. This has to be one of the best Mexican restaurants in town.

data.title: Best Mexican Food in Muncie
data.text: This place is by far the best Mexican food in town. People will recommend Puerto Vallarta but this place blows it out of the water. Fresh food and good prices.

data.title: Enjoy the food, staff and atmosphere
data.text: Because this Mexican restaurant is not the closest one to our house, my husband and I had not been frequent customers until this year. With each visit, we enjoy our food and drinks even more than the last time. The portions may not be the largest you would get at other restaurants, but they are by no means small. They are perfectly filling. I leave completely satisfied and still have some rice, beans or cheese left behind. And, in our experience, the staff members have been very attentive and quick, even when the restaurant is full. It has become my favorite Mexican restaurant in town.

data.title: Getting bad
data.text: Seems like they have cut back on the quantity and quality.  Probably be a long time before I come back.

data.title: Hard Working Staff
data.text:
Group of seven of us rolled in on a Tuesday evening when the place was evidently expecting a slow night--only one server.  Right after us a group of 10 came in and there was a another group on the patio.

Server did a very good job hustling around to get everyone served drinks, take orders and get the food out while still hot.  Kitchen help and cashier assisted carrying food, but the lone server seemed to be the only one checking on diners.

Food was good and I'm not a fan of Mexican food.

data.title: Good Mexican food in Muncie!
data.text: We really enjoyed the chips and salsa here.  We ordered the fajitas and enchiladas, both were very tasty. Cute restaurant in downtown Muncie.  We would go back for sure!

data.title: Good Mexican and Tex-Mex -- better than the other guys in town!
data.text: The food here is pretty good, and certainly the best Mexican in Muncie (except for Cuidad Colonial, their partner restaurant in Muncie Mall, which has an identical menu). Prices are reasonable, and there are many selections -- I like the fish tacos myself. If you are looking for Mexican food in Muncie, you will of course notice that there is another popular local chain. Go to Casa Del Sol or Ciudad Colonial instead of those other guys! There is a VERY wide quality gap between them. People familiar with restaurant food in Indiana know that many places suffer from terrible blandness. Casa Del Sol and Ciudad are spicy and tasty.  The other guys -- bland.

data.title: Casa Del Sol-a Fiesta downtown Muncie
data.text: There is a wide variety of scrumptious Mexican food and beverages to accompany.  There's also a nice quiet room for meetings or private occasions.

data.title: Delicous Mexican Cuisine Downtown Muncie Indiana!
data.text:
Casa Del Sol (located at 204 S Walnut St, Muncie, IN) has excellent Mexican Cuisine! The atmosphere is classy, bright, and fresh in the terms of decor! The booths and tables beg for the food about to await the people! Grab a cervesa to supplement the meal about to await you! They have a wide selection of soft drinks, beers, margaritas (both frozen and over ice), wine, and cocktails. 

The Appetizers (to share) include classics like Fajitas, Nachos, and Quesadillas; all are great. 

For the main course: I suggest any one of the "Casa Del Sol" Favorites, anything on the chicken (pollo) dishes, as well as the beef or chicken quesadillas. The Enchiladas Rancheros as well as the Burrito Boom are also a great bet for sharing amongst more than one person! 

This is a great place to start your night in Muncie before going bar hopping Downtown! Great food, service and decor!

data.title: One of my favorites
data.text: Very good food and drinks here!  One of the best Mexican restaurants in Muncie. I really like the chicken fajita quesadilla.

data.title: Downtown Mexican food at a reasonable price
data.text: This is a nice little downtown restaurant in Muncie, IN that typically has great service and piping hot food.  There have been a couple of times when the shrimp in my shrimp fajitas has been a bit skimpy, but overall, a good value for the price.

data.title: No Margs
data.text: Sometimes this one lady says my friends and i can not have margs! Soggy nachos and no margs make me so so sad

data.title: Eat here, you will like it.
data.text: Good food, great drinks and a very nicely decorated establishment. We have eaten here many times since it opened a few years ago. I would recommend it to anyone.

data.title: Soggy Nachos and Keyboard Music
data.text: If you like prerecorded keyboard music and soggy nachos!!!! This is the place for you. Steam table food and plates kept warm in an oven abound. Few places on this planet can produce such a poor atmosphere.

data.title: Tasty Grub
data.text: Had the Chili Verde for lunch. Plenty of food and reasonably priced. Service was fast and friendly. Better get there early, the place filled up quickly at lunch.
